post.author: Kelly J Lee
post.content:
At least 3-5 years of professional web development experience, including at least one large-scale, successfully-launched project in a tech lead role.
Expert knowledge of PHP, including knowledge of object-oriented programming in PHP (and more importantly, having good judgement in knowing when OO should be used, and how much).

Strong experience with MYSQL/SQL and creating database schemas.
Experience using XML-RPC in PHP.
You should know your way around Unix.
Familiarity with http protocol and ability to use it for low-level troubleshooting as well as experience tweaking the configuration of Apache webservers.
Experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

Ability to work productively with minimal supervision.
Tolerance for the overhead of rapidly iterating toward greater usability. Insistence on complete/frozen specifications just won't work here.
A feel for good design -- both in terms of engineering and user experience. Along with the drive and ability to turn that feel into working products.

some nice-to-haves:
Practical knowledge of relevant W3C standards (XHTML, DOM, CSS) and the de-facto standards (XHR, browser properties, etc) is a plus.
Contributions made to an open source project
CVS / SVN
Ant
Familiarity with Eclipse

VI / Emacs
Experience writing plug-ins (for any system)
Handy with regexes
Can build small tools in Python / Perl / PHP / Ruby
Shell scripting
=========================================================
You can work off-site from the comfort of one's home
The company is in California, no travel is necessary.

Salary: $60,000/year
the developer must demonstrate past work with proven experience
